story.title: Initialize Next.js Project with Complete Tech Stack
story.user-story: As a developer, I want the Next.js 14+ project initialized with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, and proper directory structure, So that all subsequent stories have a working foundation to build upon.

criterion.name: Next.js Project Initialized
criterion.then: A Next.js 14+ project is created with: - TypeScript 5.x configured - Tailwind CSS 3.x installed and configured - App Router enabled (not Pages Router) - src/ directory structure created - Path aliases configured (@/components, @/lib, @/types)

criterion.name: shadcn/ui Initialization
criterion.and: shadcn/ui is initialized with: - components.json configuration file - Trust Blue theme configured in tailwind.config.ts - Base components installed (Button, Card, Badge, Skeleton) - Slate color palette configured as base color

criterion.name: Directory Structure Created
criterion.and: The following directory structure exists: src/ app/ layout.tsx (basic structure) page.tsx (placeholder) globals.css (Tailwind directives + Trust Blue theme) components/ ui/ (shadcn/ui components) product/ (empty, ready for stories) layout/ (empty, ready for stories) filters/ (empty, ready for stories) lib/ utils.ts (cn() utility from shadcn/ui) types/ (empty, ready for type definitions) data/ (empty, ready for JSON files) public/ images/ products/ (empty, ready for product images)

criterion.name: Trust Blue Theme Configured
criterion.and: Trust Blue theme colors are configured in tailwind.config.ts: - Primary: #2563eb (blue-600) - Primary hover: #1d4ed8 (blue-700) - Slate neutral scale (50-900) - Custom typography scale (display, h1-h4)

criterion.name: Development Server Verification
criterion.and: The development server starts successfully: - `npm run dev` runs without errors - Accessible at http://localhost:3000 - Hot module reloading works - No console errors

criterion.name: Build Process Verification
criterion.and: Build process works: - `npm run build` completes successfully - TypeScript compilation passes - No linting errors

epic.name: Foundation & Project Setup
epic.goal: Initialize Next.js 14+ project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, and proper project structure to enable all subsequent development.
epic.user-value: Establishes the technical foundation required for all features. (Foundation exception - acceptable as first epic for greenfield project)
epic.covers-functional-requirements: Infrastructure foundation for all functional requirements

stories.story-ref: Initialize Next.js Project with Complete Tech Stack (THIS STORY)

epic.success-criteria: A developer can run `npm run dev`, access http://localhost:3000, and see a working Next.js application with the Trust Blue theme applied and zero TypeScript/lint errors.

starter-template.name: Next.js 14+ with App Router
starter-template.provides: - Next.js 14+ with React 18+ - TypeScript configuration - Tailwind CSS setup - App Router (modern Next.js architecture) - ESLint for code quality - src/ directory structure - Path aliases (@/components, @/lib, @/types) - Fast Refresh development server - Production-optimized build system
starter-template.post-init-steps: 1. Install shadcn/ui: `npx shadcn@latest init` 2. Configure Trust Blue theme in `tailwind.config.ts` 3. Add initial shadcn/ui components: `npx shadcn@latest add button card badge`

project-initialization.version-rationale: - Next.js 14+ provides App Router, Server Components, and optimized images critical for product catalog performance - React 18+ enables Server Components for better initial page load - TypeScript 5.x offers improved type inference and performance - Tailwind CSS 3.x provides JIT compilation for smaller bundle sizes - shadcn/ui uses latest Radix UI primitives for WCAG AA accessibility

directory-structure.structure: ecommerce-shop/ ├── src/ │ ├── app/ # Next.js App Router │ │ ├── layout.tsx # Root layout (header/footer) │ │ ├── page.tsx # Homepage (product grid) │ │ └── globals.css # Tailwind + custom styles │ ├── components/ # Organized by domain │ │ ├── ui/ # shadcn/ui components │ │ ├── product/ # Product-specific components │ │ ├── layout/ # Layout components │ │ └── filters/ # Filtering components │ ├── lib/ # Utilities & helpers │ │ └── utils.ts # shadcn/ui cn() utility │ ├── types/ # TypeScript type definitions │ └── data/ # Static data (Phase 1) ├── public/ # Static assets │ └── images/ # Product images └── [config files]
directory-structure.rationale: - Easy to locate components by feature - Clear separation of concerns - Scales well when adding new domains (cart, checkout in Phase 2) - AI agents know exactly where to create new components - src/ directory separates source code from configuration files - data/ for static JSON provides single source of truth for Phase 1 product data

theme-configuration.name: Trust Blue Theme
theme-configuration.rationale: Trust Blue communicates professionalism and credibility - essential for a digital goods marketplace where users can't physically inspect products. The blue palette signals security and reliability, while maintaining a modern, clean aesthetic.

architectural-constraints.constraint: Next.js 14+ App Router architecture required (no Pages Router)
src/ directory pattern must be used
shadcn/ui copy-paste approach (no full component library dependency)

technical-specification.overview: Epic 1 establishes the complete technical foundation for the ecommerce-shop Phase 1 UI implementation. This epic initializes a Next.js 14+ project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui component library, configures the Trust Blue design system, and creates the project structure that will support all subsequent feature development.

scope.in-scope: - Next.js 14+ project initialization with App Router architecture - TypeScript 5.x configuration with strict type checking - Tailwind CSS 3.x installation and Trust Blue theme configuration - shadcn/ui component library initialization (Button, Card, Badge, Skeleton) - Complete project directory structure creation (src/app, src/components, src/types, src/lib, src/data) - Path aliases configuration (@/components, @/lib, @/types) - Development server setup and verification - Production build pipeline verification - ESLint and code quality tooling
scope.out-of-scope: - Product data models and sample data (Epic 3) - UI component implementation (Epic 2) - Page layouts and routing (Epics 4-5) - Testing infrastructure (Phase 2) - Deployment configuration (Epic 6 polish phase)

design-system.name: shadcn/ui
design-system.rationale: Modern, Tailwind CSS-based component library that aligns perfectly with "Trustworthy & Modern" aesthetic. Provides clean, polished components with accessibility built-in (WCAG compliant).
design-system.benefits: - Modern & Professional appearance - Highly customizable (copy-paste with full control) - Tailwind CSS integration for fast development - Excellent for e-commerce (card layouts, grids) - Next.js integration - Active development and maintenance

color-theme.name: Trust Blue

palette.neutral: Slate scale (50-900) for backgrounds, text, borders

color-theme.rationale: Trust Blue communicates professionalism and credibility - essential for digital goods marketplace where users can't physically inspect products. Blue palette signals security and reliability while maintaining modern, clean aesthetic.

ux-design.spacing-system: - 4px base unit (Tailwind default) - Consistent padding/margin using Tailwind spacing scale - Component spacing: p-4 (16px) standard, p-6 (24px) for cards

prd-reference.phase-scope: Phase 1: Product listing homepage + Product detail pages + Navigation (No cart, checkout, or payment functionality)
prd-reference.objectives: 1. Visual Foundation: Establish modern, clean UI design system 2. Product Discovery: Enable users to browse and explore digital products 3. Information Display: Present product details clearly and attractively 4. Navigation Patterns: Implement intuitive navigation 5. Responsive Design: Excellent experience on desktop and mobile
prd-reference.success-criteria: - Homepage displays categorized product listings - Users can navigate from homepage to product detail pages - Product detail pages show comprehensive information - UI is responsive (mobile and desktop) - Page load times < 2 seconds - Clean, professional visual design

non-functional-requirements.performance: - Page load time < 2 seconds - Smooth 60fps interactions
non-functional-requirements.accessibility: - WCAG AA compliance - Keyboard navigation - Screen reader support
non-functional-requirements.design: - Professional modern aesthetic - Trust Blue theme - Consistent visual language

product-brief.vision: A digital goods marketplace for the US market that enables instant purchase and delivery of software licenses, game keys, AI subscriptions, and digital tools. Clean, modern UX optimized for speed and simplicity.
product-brief.target-users: Digital Product Consumers (US Market) - Age 18-45, tech-comfortable individuals who value convenience and instant access. Gamers, professionals, students, AI enthusiasts, small businesses.
product-brief.phase-1-focus: UI Foundation - Product browsing experience without payment/checkout. Establish visual design, information architecture, and navigation patterns for future commerce functionality.

constraints.phase-1-limitations: - No backend/API integration (static data only) - No user authentication (deferred to Phase 2) - No shopping cart functionality (deferred to Phase 2) - No payment processing (deferred to Phase 2)
constraints.browser-support: - Modern browsers only (Chrome, Firefox, Safari latest) - No IE11 support
constraints.environment-requirements: - Node.js 18+ must be pre-installed - Compatible with macOS, Linux, Windows (with WSL recommended) - Requires stable internet connection for npm install

future-considerations.to-address-in-later-phases: - Testing framework setup (Phase 2) - CI/CD pipeline configuration (Phase 2) - Environment variable management (Phase 2) - Production deployment configuration (Phase 2) - Analytics integration (Phase 2) - Monitoring/observability setup (Phase 2)
future-considerations.phase-2-preparation: - .env.local already in .gitignore (ready for API keys) - Dark mode configured in tailwind but not implemented (ready for toggle) - Component structure ready to add state management if needed

decision.what: Use Next.js 14+ App Router (not Pages Router)
decision.why: Server Components for better performance, modern architecture, Phase 2 ready
Prevent runtime errors, better autocomplete, team consistency
Clean root directory, standard Next.js pattern
Full code ownership, easier Trust Blue customization, no large dependencies

gotchas.item: Make sure to select "Slate" as base color during shadcn/ui init (not blue)
Trust Blue theme requires manual configuration in tailwind.config.ts after init
shadcn/ui components must be added AFTER initialization is complete
Directory structure should be created before starting Epic 2 work

implementation-notes.next-story-handoff: After Story 1.1 completion, the next developer should be able to immediately start Story 2.1 (Tailwind configuration) without any additional setup steps. Verify that: - Project builds successfully - All directories exist - shadcn/ui components are accessible - Trust Blue theme is partially configured (will be completed in 2.1)
